item.title: Robustly Optimal Mechanisms for Selling Multiple Goods
item.description: arXiv:2105.02828v4 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We study robustly optimal mechanisms for selling multiple items. The seller maximizes revenue against a worst-case distribution of a buyer's valuations within a set of distributions, called an "ambiguity" set. We identify the exact forms of robustly optimal selling mechanisms and the worst-case distributions when the ambiguity set satisfies various moment conditions on the values of subsets of goods. The analysis reveals general properties of the ambiguity set that justifies categorical bundling, which includes separate sales and pure bundling as special cases.
item.dc:creator: Yeon-Koo Che, Weijie Zhong

item.title: Fuzzy Classification Aggregation
item.description: arXiv:2402.17620v4 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We consider the problem where a set of individuals has to classify $m$ objects into $p$ categories and does so by aggregating the individual classifications. We show that if $m\geq 3$, $m\geq p\geq 2$, and classifications are fuzzy, that is, objects belong to a category to a certain degree, then an optimal and independent aggregator rule that satisfies a weak unanimity condition belongs to the family of Weighted Arithmetic Means. We also obtain characterization results for $m= p= 2$.
item.dc:creator: Federico Fioravanti
